FGCU faced instate rival USF in Tampa on Saturday Sept PERIOD  PERIOD After having their last match against Penn canceled due to weather the Eagles were looking to end the Bulls home unbeaten streak but FGCU fell short in a  loss PERIOD
With senior goalkeeper Nathan Ingham out with an ankle sprain FGCU freshman Sawyer Jackman started his first game between the sticks for the Eagles PERIOD After a scoreless first half there was a weather delay that extended the halftime break to more than an hour PERIOD Twenty minutes after the game resumed the Bulls struck first with a goal by Melvin Becket PERIOD Six minutes later the Eagles went soaring into the box when FGCUs Justin Gavin making his debut was taken down PERIOD
The referee awarded the Eagles a shot from the spot which was converted by Albert Ruiz who was also making his debut for the Eagles PERIOD
With  minutes left to play the Eagles were searching for a late goal to win the game PERIOD In the eighty-second minute FGCUs Rodrigo Saravia took down a USF player in the box giving the Bulls a penalty kick PERIOD USFs Nazeem Bartman stepped up and put the ball in the back of the net giving the Bulls a  lead PERIOD The Bulls went on to win the game by that score handing the Eagles their second loss of the season PERIOD
The Eagles will look to bounce back on Friday Sept PERIOD  when they travel to Rhode Island to take on the Brown Bears PERIOD
